findings.title: Duplicate ERC20 tokens will send a greater than prorata token share leading to loss of DAO funds
findings.description: No sanity checks for duplicate ERC20 tokens in the erc20tokens parameter

findings.title: A malicious proposer can create arbitrary number of maliciously updatable proposals to significantly grief the protocol
findings.description: Malicious proposers can create arbitrary proposals by transferring/delegating their Nouns and update them to be malicious

findings.title: Malicious proposer can update proposal past inattentive voters to sneak in otherwise unacceptable details
findings.description: A malicious proposer updates a proposal with unacceptable transactions/description to get support of inattentive voters.

findings.title: 51% Attack Vector
findings.description: Renouncing veto power or removing/blocking rage quit function can lead to 51% attacks.

findings.title: Potential re-minting of previously burnt NounsTokenFork
findings.description: Allows for a previously burned NounsTokenFork to be re-minted.

findings.title: A single invalid/expired/cancelled signature will prevent the creation and updation of proposals
findings.description: Verification of proposal signatures may fail due to a single invalid signature.

findings.title: Missing require checks in NounsDAOV3Proposals.execute() and executeOnTimelockV1() functions
findings.description: Lack of require checks can lead to Denial of Service or incorrect execution paths.

findings.title: Due to misaligned DAO and Executors logic any proposal will be blocked from execution at 'eta + GRACE_PERIOD' timestamp
findings.description: Inconsistency in treatment of eta + GRACE_PERIOD moment can block proposal execution.

findings.title: A malicious DAO can increase the odds of proposal defeat by setting a very high value of lastMinuteWindowInBlocks
findings.description: Malicious majority can abuse objection-only period by setting a high value of lastMinuteWindowInBlocks.

findings.title: Use custom errors instead of revert strings
findings.description: Using custom errors saves gas and is more convenient.

findings.title: escrowedTokensByForkId can be used to get owner of escrowed tokens
findings.description: Removing redundant function ownerOfEscrowedToken() can reduce code and deployment cost.

findings.title: Emit events using locally assigned variables instead of reading from storage to save on SLOAD
findings.description: Saving gas by emitting local variables over storage variables.

findings.title: joinFork() violates Checks-Effects-Interactions best practice for reentrancy mitigation
findings.description: Implementing the Checks-Effects-Interactions best practice can enhance security.

findings.title: Rename MAX_VOTING_PERIOD and MAX_VOTING_DELAY to enhance readability
findings.description: Enhancing readability by renaming variables.

findings.title: External function is used instead of internal equivalent across NounsDAOV3Proposals logic
findings.description: Using internal functions for better performance.

findings.title: Proposals created through proposeBySigs() can not be executed on TimelockV1
findings.description: Allowing proposals to be executed on TimelockV1 for more flexibility.

findings.title: escrowToFork() can be frontrun to prevent users from joining the fork during the escrow period
findings.description: Preventing frontrunning attacks on escrowToFork().

findings.title: Known issues from previous versions/audit
findings.description: Multiple known issues (delegateBySigs allows delegating to address zero, Voting gas refund can be abused, Nouns transfers will stop working when block number hits uint32 max value, AuctionHouse has an open gas griefing vector)

findings.title: When a minority forks, the majority can follow
findings.description: Majority can attack minority fork DAO by joining and then quitting to drain treasury

findings.title: The original DAO can temporarily brick a fork DAOâ€™s token minting
findings.description: Original DAO can update descriptor to revert fork token mint function

findings.title: Unused events, missing events and unindexed event parameters in contracts
findings.description: Multiple issues with events in various contracts (INounsTokenFork.sol, NounsDAOV3Admin.sol, NounsDAOEventsFork.sol)

findings.title: Prefer using __Ownable_init instead of _transferOwnership to initialize upgradable contracts
findings.description: Deviation from standard approach for initializing upgradable contracts

findings.title: Consider emitting the address of the timelock in the ProposalQueued event
findings.description: Missing timelock address information in ProposalQueued event

findings.title: Typos, comments and descriptions need to be updated
findings.description: Various typographical errors and misaligned comments/descriptions.

findings.title: No need to use an assembly block to get the chain ID
findings.description: Unnecessary assembly block usage
